title: TVLine Items: Jimmy Johnson Retires From Fox Sports, PAW Patrol Double Renewal and More
description: Jimmy Johnson is retiring from Fox Sports after 31 years at the network. The Fox NFL studio analyst and former NFL coach made the announcement on The Herd With Colin Cowherd, stating, “Probably the most fun I’ve ever had in my career, and that’s counting Super Bowls and national championships, was at Fox Sports… But […]
author: Vlada Gelman
excerpt: Fox NFL studio analyst Jimmy Johnson is retiring from Fox Sports after 31 years at the network — watch his announcement.
text: Jimmy Johnson is retiring from Fox Sports after 31 years at the network. The Fox NFL studio analyst and former NFL coach made the announcement on The Herd With Colin Cowherd, stating, “Probably the most fun I’ve ever had in my career, and that’s counting Super Bowls and national championships, was at Fox Sports… But I’ve made an extremely difficult decision.” Johnson added that he’s been thinking about retiring “for the last four or five years.” “I’m going to miss it. I’m going to miss all the guys, and I’ll see them occasionally, but it has been a great run starting back 31 years ago,” he said. Johnson first joined Fox Sports in 1994 as an analyst on the Fox NFL Sunday pregame show. Watch Johnson’s full announcement below: Jimmy Johnson just announced his retirement from Fox Sports on The Herd pic.twitter.com/bpBzbR2XSz— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) March 3, 2025 Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well… * PAW Patrol has been renewed for Seasons 12 and 13 at Nickelodeon, while Rubble & Crew has been picked up for Seasons 3 and 4. (Season 10 of PAW Patrol will be available on Paramount+ beginning Wednesday, March 19.)  * Michael Angarano (This Is Us) will recur in Apple TV+’s forthcoming series-adaptation of the novel Margo’s Got Money Troubles as an English professor who has an affair with Elle Fanning’s titular character, our sister site Deadline reports. * Who gets the baby back when the baby is Nikki herself? That’s the question raised by the first trailer for Alert: MPU Season 3, premiering Tuesday, March 25 at 9/8c, on Fox: * Max has released a trailer for the original movie The Parenting, premiering Thursday, March 13: Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
html:
Jimmy Johnson is retiring from Fox Sports after 31 years at the network.

The Fox NFL studio analyst and former NFL coach made the announcement on The Herd With Colin Cowherd, stating, “Probably the most fun I’ve ever had in my career, and that’s counting Super Bowls and national championships, was at Fox Sports… But I’ve made an extremely difficult decision.”

Johnson added that he’s been thinking about retiring “for the last four or five years.”

“I’m going to miss it. I’m going to miss all the guys, and I’ll see them occasionally, but it has been a great run starting back 31 years ago,” he said.

Johnson first joined Fox Sports in 1994 as an analyst on the Fox NFL Sunday pregame show.

Watch Johnson’s full announcement below:

Jimmy Johnson just announced his retirement from Fox Sports on The Herd pic.twitter.com/bpBzbR2XSz

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) March 3, 2025

Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well…

* PAW Patrol has been renewed for Seasons 12 and 13 at Nickelodeon, while Rubble & Crew has been picked up for Seasons 3 and 4. (Season 10 of PAW Patrol will be available on Paramount+ beginning Wednesday, March 19.) 

* Michael Angarano (This Is Us) will recur in Apple TV+’s forthcoming series-adaptation of the novel Margo’s Got Money Troubles as an English professor who has an affair with Elle Fanning’s titular character, our sister site Deadline reports.

* Who gets the baby back when the baby is Nikki herself? That’s the question raised by the first trailer for Alert: MPU Season 3, premiering Tuesday, March 25 at 9/8c, on Fox:

* Max has released a trailer for the original movie The Parenting, premiering Thursday, March 13:

Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
